00049         string(int number)
00050         : allocated(0), used(0), array(0)
00051         {
00052                 // store if negative and make positive
00053 
00054                 bool negative = false;
00055                 if (number < 0)
00056                 {
00057                         number *= -1;
00058                         negative = true;
00059                 }
00060 
00061                 // temporary buffer for 16 numbers
00062 
00063                 c8 tmpbuf[16];
00064                 tmpbuf[15] = 0;
00065                 s32 idx = 15;   
00066 
00067                 // special case '0'
00068 
00069                 if (!number) 
00070                 {
00071                         tmpbuf[14] = '0';
00072                         *this = &tmpbuf[14];
00073                         return;
00074                 }
00075 
00076                 // add numbers
00077 
00078                 while(number && idx)
00079                 {
00080                         idx--;  
00081                         tmpbuf[idx] = (c8)('0' + (number % 10));
00082                         number = number / 10;                                   
00083                 }
00084 
00085                 // add sign
00086 
00087                 if (negative)
00088                 {
00089                         idx--;
00090                         tmpbuf[idx] = '-';                      
00091                 }
00092 
00093                 *this = &tmpbuf[idx];
00094         }
00095

00099         template <class B>
00100         string(const B* c, s32 lenght)
00101         : allocated(0), used(0), array(0)
00102         {
00103                 if (!c)
00104                         return;
00105 
00106         allocated = used = lenght+1;
00107                 array = new T[used];
00108 
00109                 for (s32 l = 0; l<lenght; ++l)
00110                         array[l] = (T)c[l];
00111 
00112                 array[lenght] = 0;
00113         }

00136         string<T>& operator=(const string<T>& other) 
00137         {
00138                 if (this == &other)
00139                         return *this;
00140 
00141                 delete [] array;
00142                 allocated = used = other.size()+1;
00143                 array = new T[used];
00144 
00145                 const T* p = other.c_str();
00146                 for (s32 i=0; i<used; ++i, ++p)
00147                         array[i] = *p;
00148 
00149                 return *this;
00150         }

00153 
00155         template <class B>
00156         string<T>& operator=(const B* c) 
00157         {
00158                 if (!c)
00159                 {
00160                         if (!array)
00161                         {
00162                                 array = new T[1];
00163                                 allocated = 1;
00164                                 used = 1;
00165                         }
00166                         array[0] = 0x0;
00167                         return *this;
00168                 }
00169 
00170                 if ((void*)c == (void*)array)
00171                         return *this;
00172 
00173                 s32 len = 0;
00174                 const B* p = c;
00175                 while(*p)
00176                 {
00177                         ++len;
00178                         ++p;
00179                 }
00180 
00181                 // we'll take the old string for a while, because the new string could be
00182                 // a part of the current string.
00183                 T* oldArray = array;
00184 
00185         allocated = used = len+1;
00186                 array = new T[used];
00187 
00188                 for (s32 l = 0; l<len+1; ++l)
00189                         array[l] = (T)c[l];
00190 
00191                 delete [] oldArray;
00192                 return *this;
00193         }
00194

00197         { 
00198                 string<T> str(*this); 
00199                 str.append(other);

00201                 return str;

00226         bool operator ==(const T* str) const
00227         {
00228                 int i;
00229                 for(i=0; array[i] && str[i]; ++i)
00230                         if (array[i] != str[i])
00231                                 return false;
00232 
00233                 return !array[i] && !str[i];
00234         }

00240         {
00241                 for(s32 i=0; array[i] && other.array[i]; ++i)
00242                         if (array[i] != other.array[i])
00243                                 return false;
00244

00251         bool operator <(const string<T>& other) const
00252         {
00253                 for(s32 i=0; array[i] && other.array[i]; ++i)
00254                         if (array[i] != other.array[i])
00255                                 return (array[i] < other.array[i]);
00256 
00257                 return used < other.used;
00258         }

00289         void make_lower()
00290         {
00291                 const T A = (T)'A';
00292                 const T Z = (T)'Z';
00293                 const T diff = (T)'a' - A;
00294 
00295                 for (s32 i=0; i<used; ++i)
00296                 {
00297                         if (array[i]>=A && array[i]<=Z)
00298                                 array[i] += diff;
00299                 }
00300         }
00301

00303 
00305         void make_upper()
00306         {
00307                 const T a = (T)'a';
00308                 const T z = (T)'z';
00309                 const T diff = (T)'A' - a;
00310 
00311                 for (s32 i=0; i<used; ++i)
00312                 {
00313                         if (array[i]>=a && array[i]<=z)
00314                                 array[i] += diff;
00315                 }
00316         }

00323         bool equals_ignore_case(const string<T>& other) const
00324         {
00325                 for(s32 i=0; array[i] && other[i]; ++i)
00326                         if (toLower(array[i]) != toLower(other[i]))
00327                                 return false;
00328 
00329                 return used == other.used;
00330         }

00332 
00334         bool equalsn(const string<T>& other, int len)
00335         {
00336                 int i;
00337                 for(i=0; array[i] && other[i] && i < len; ++i)
00338                         if (array[i] != other[i])
00339                                 return false;
00340 
00341                 // if one (or both) of the strings was smaller then they
00342                 // are only equal if they have the same lenght
00343                 return (i == len) || (used == other.used);
00344         }
00345 
00346 
00348         bool equalsn(const T* str, int len)
00349         {
00350                 int i;  
00351                 for(i=0; array[i] && str[i] && i < len; ++i)
00352                         if (array[i] != str[i])
00353                                 return false;
00354 
00355                 // if one (or both) of the strings was smaller then they
00356                 // are only equal if they have the same lenght
00357                 return (i == len) || (array[i] == 0 && str[i] == 0);
00358         }

00362 
00363         void append(T character)
00364         {
00365                 if (used + 1 > allocated)
00366                         reallocate((s32)used + 1);
00367 
00368                 used += 1;
00369 
00370                 array[used-2] = character;
00371                 array[used-1] = 0;
00372         }
00373 
00375 
00376         void append(const string<T>& other)
00377         {
00378                 --used;
00379 
00380                 s32 len = other.size();
00381                 
00382                 if (used + len + 1 > allocated)
00383                         reallocate((s32)used + (s32)len + 1);
00384 
00385                 for (s32 l=0; l<len+1; ++l)
00386                         array[l+used] = other[l];
00387 
00388                 used = used + len + 1;
00389         }
00390 
00391 
00393 
00395         void append(const string<T>& other, s32 length)
00396         {
00397                 s32 len = other.size();
00398 
00399                 if (len < length)
00400                 {
00401                         append(other);
00402                         return;
00403                 }
00404 
00405                 len = length;
00406                 --used;
00407                 
00408                 if (used + len > allocated)
00409                         reallocate((s32)used + (s32)len);
00410 
00411                 for (s32 l=0; l<len; ++l)
00412                         array[l+used] = other[l];
00413 
00414                 used = used + len;
00415         }

00420         void reserve(s32 count)
00421         {
00422                 if (count < allocated)
00423                         return;
00424 
00425                 reallocate(count);
00426         }

00433         s32 findFirst(T c) const
00434         {
00435                 for (s32 i=0; i<used; ++i)
00436                         if (array[i] == c)
00437                                 return i;
00438 
00439                 return -1;

00449         s32 findFirstChar(T* c, int count) const
00450         {
00451                 for (s32 i=0; i<used; ++i)
00452                         for (int j=0; j<count; ++j)
00453                                 if (array[i] == c[j])
00454                                         return i;
00455 
00456                 return -1;
00457         }

00467         template <class B> 
00468         s32 findFirstCharNotInList(B* c, int count) const
00469         {
00470                 for (int i=0; i<used; ++i)
00471                 {
00472             int j;
00473                         for (j=0; j<count; ++j)
00474                                 if (array[i] == c[j])
00475                                         break;
00476 
00477                         if (j==count)
00478                                 return i;
00479                 }
00480 
00481                 return -1;
00482         }
00483 
00485 
00491         template <class B> 
00492         s32 findLastCharNotInList(B* c, int count) const
00493         {
00494                 for (int i=used-2; i>=0; --i)
00495                 {
00496             int j;
00497                         for (j=0; j<count; ++j)
00498                                 if (array[i] == c[j])
00499                                         break;
00500 
00501                         if (j==count)
00502                                 return i;
00503                 }
00504 
00505                 return -1;
00506         }

00528         {
00529                 for (s32 i=used-1; i>=0; --i)

00531                                 return i;
00532

00540         string<T> subString(s32 begin, s32 length)
00541         {
00542                 if (length <= 0)
00543                         return string<T>("");
00544 
00545                 string<T> o;
00546                 o.reserve(length+1);
00547 
00548                 for (s32 i=0; i<length; ++i)
00549                         o.array[i] = array[i+begin];
00550 
00551                 o.array[length] = 0;
00552                 o.used = o.allocated;
00553 
00554                 return o;
00555         }

00574         void replace(T toReplace, T replaceWith)
00575         {
00576                 for (s32 i=0; i<used; ++i)
00577                         if (array[i] == toReplace)
00578                                 array[i] = replaceWith;
00579         }

00582 
00583         void trim()
00584         {
00585                 const char whitespace[] = " \t\n";
00586                 const int whitespacecount = 3;
00587 
00588                 // find start and end of real string without whitespace
00589                 int begin = findFirstCharNotInList(whitespace, whitespacecount);
00590                 if (begin == -1)
00591                         return;
00592 
00593                 int end = findLastCharNotInList(whitespace, whitespacecount);
00594                 if (end == -1)
00595                         return;
00596 
00597                 *this = subString(begin, (end +1) - begin);
00598         }

00604         void erase(int index)
00605         {
00606                 _IRR_DEBUG_BREAK_IF(index>=used || index<0) // access violation
00607 
00608                 for (int i=index+1; i<used; ++i)
00609                         array[i-1] = array[i];
00610 
00611                 --used;
00612         }

00617 
00619         T toLower(const T& t) const
00620         {
00621                 if (t>=(T)'A' && t<=(T)'Z')
00622                         return t + ((T)'a' - (T)'A');
00623                 else
00624                         return t;
00625         }
00626 
00628         void reallocate(s32 new_size)
00629         {
00630                 T* old_array = array;
00631 
00632                 array = new T[new_size];
00633                 allocated = new_size;
00634                 
00635                 s32 amount = used < new_size ? used : new_size;
00636                 for (s32 i=0; i<amount; ++i)
00637                         array[i] = old_array[i];
00638 
00639                 if (allocated < used)
00640                         used = allocated;
00641                 
00642                 delete [] old_array;
00643         }
00644
